name: Hon. Situmbeko Musokotwane
organization: Ministry of Finance and National Planning
notes: Key stakeholder for dividend policy, financial oversight, and government shareholder directions to SOEs. Regular briefings on financial performance required.

engagements.subject: Annual Performance Review 2024
engagements.attendees: IDC CEO, IDC CFO, Ministry PS, Ministry Finance Director
engagements.summary: Reviewed IDC portfolio performance and dividend remittance targets for 2024 and 2025
engagements.outcomes: Agreed on 2025 dividend targets of ZMW 350 million to GRZ; Ministry requested enhanced quarterly reporting
engagements.followUpActions: IDC to submit dividend schedule by February 2025; IDC to provide quarterly portfolio dashboard to Ministry

engagements.subject: ZESCO Tariff Review and Subsidy Framework 2025
engagements.attendees: ZESCO CEO, ZESCO CFO, Ministry PS, ERB CEO
engagements.summary: ZESCO presented financial impact of proposed tariff adjustments and current government subsidy arrangements
engagements.outcomes: Ministry committed to reviewing subsidy framework and confirming 2025 support levels by end of March
engagements.followUpActions: ZESCO to submit formal tariff application to ERB; Ministry to confirm subsidy budget allocation

name: Hon. Peter Kapala
notes: Primary ministerial oversight for ZESCO. Key decision-maker on energy policy, tariff approvals, and capital project authorisations. Monthly briefings maintained.

engagements.subject: El Niño Drought Emergency — Load Shedding Response Briefing
engagements.attendees: ZESCO CEO, ZESCO Board Chair, Ministry PS, ERB CEO, Energy Advisor
engagements.summary: ZESCO briefed the Minister on the critical water situation at Kariba Dam and load shedding schedule. Emergency diesel procurement plan presented.
engagements.outcomes: Minister approved emergency procurement waiver; committed to engaging Treasury for supplementary budget
engagements.followUpActions: ZESCO to submit weekly update to Ministry on dam levels and load shedding schedule; ERB to fast-track emergency procurement approval

engagements.subject: Kafue Gorge Lower Project Site Inspection
engagements.attendees: ZESCO CEO, Director of Engineering, Ministry PS, Ministry Technical Team, Chinese contractor representatives
engagements.summary: Minister conducted site visit to inspect progress on Kafue Gorge Lower 750 MW hydropower project. Construction at 88% completion observed.
engagements.outcomes: Minister directed ZESCO and contractor to accelerate final commissioning; commissioning target set for Q2 2025
engagements.followUpActions: ZESCO to submit monthly commissioning progress report to Ministry; contractor to submit revised completion schedule

name: Hon. Frank Tayali
notes: Oversight Minister for Zambia Railways. Key stakeholder for railway policy, TAZARA negotiations, and infrastructure investment approvals. Quarterly engagement maintained.

engagements.subject: Zambia Railways Turnaround Strategy Review
engagements.attendees: ZRL CEO, ZRL Board Chair, Ministry PS, IDC CEO, Ministry Infrastructure Director
engagements.summary: ZRL presented the 2024–2026 turnaround strategy to the Minister. Highlighted key challenges including fleet condition, track quality, and commercial competitiveness.
engagements.outcomes: Minister committed to advocating for capital allocation in 2025 national budget; directed IDC to continue financial support
engagements.followUpActions: ZRL to submit quarterly turnaround progress reports; Ministry to confirm 2025 capital allocation by August 2024

engagements.subject: TAZARA Concession Negotiation Framework
engagements.attendees: ZRL CEO, Ministry PS, Ministry Legal Advisor, SADC Transport Director, Tanzania Ministry representative via video
engagements.summary: Consulted with the Minister on the negotiating mandate for the TAZARA joint concession. Discussed key commercial, operational, and governance terms.
engagements.outcomes: Minister approved the negotiating principles; directed ZRL to engage SADC Secretariat for process facilitation
engagements.followUpActions: ZRL to present detailed negotiating mandate to board for approval; Ministry to schedule joint session with Tanzania counterpart

name: Dr. Denny Kalyalya
notes: Apex banking regulator. Primary regulator for ZANACO. Regulatory directives on capital adequacy, KYC, AML/CFT, and digital banking must be monitored closely.

engagements.subject: ZANACO KYC Remediation and AML Compliance Review
engagements.attendees: ZANACO MD/CEO, Chief Compliance Officer, BOZ Bank Supervision Director, BOZ Legal Counsel
engagements.summary: Formal regulatory meeting following BOZ directive on KYC remediation. ZANACO presented compliance action plan and resource allocation.
engagements.outcomes: BOZ accepted ZANACO's action plan; set 90-day review milestone; ZMW 45 million remediation budget acknowledged
engagements.followUpActions: ZANACO to submit monthly KYC remediation progress reports to BOZ; BOZ to conduct on-site review in August 2024

engagements.subject: Annual Supervisory Meeting 2024 — Capital Adequacy and Basel III
engagements.attendees: ZANACO MD/CEO, CFO, Chief Risk Officer, BOZ Bank Supervision Director, BOZ Capital Team
engagements.summary: Annual supervisory meeting reviewing ZANACO's capital adequacy, risk management, and Basel III implementation progress.
engagements.outcomes: BOZ noted ZANACO's strong capital position at 18.2% CAR; affirmed Basel III compliance timeline to Q2 2025
engagements.followUpActions: ZANACO to submit Basel III readiness report by January 2025; BOZ to issue final guidance on pillar 2 requirements

name: Eng. Boniface Zulu
notes: ERB regulates electricity tariffs, licences, and quality of service standards. Critical regulator for ZESCO. Tariff negotiations and performance agreements require regular engagement.

engagements.subject: 2025 Electricity Tariff Review Consultation
engagements.attendees: ZESCO CEO, CFO, Tariff Manager, ERB CEO, ERB Technical Director, ERB Consumer Affairs Officer
engagements.summary: Formal tariff review consultation. ZESCO presented detailed cost-reflective tariff application requesting 28% average tariff adjustment for 2025.
engagements.outcomes: ERB acknowledged ZESCO's financial pressures; committed to completing tariff review process by December 2024; consumer impact assessment initiated
engagements.followUpActions: ZESCO to submit supplementary financial modelling by 31 October 2024; ERB to hold public consultations in November 2024

engagements.subject: Quality of Service Performance Review 2024
engagements.attendees: ZESCO CEO, Operations Director, ERB CEO, ERB Quality Assurance Director
engagements.summary: ERB presented performance scorecard for 2024 noting SAIDI and SAIFI above target thresholds. ZESCO provided explanations for outage incidents.
engagements.outcomes: ZESCO committed to quality improvement plan; ZMW 45 million ring-fenced for reliability improvements in 2025
engagements.followUpActions: ZESCO to submit updated quality improvement plan by March 2025; quarterly performance reviews scheduled for 2025

name: Dr. Chibamba Kanyama
notes: ZEMA regulates environmental compliance for energy and transport infrastructure projects. Environmental Impact Assessments and compliance certificates required for capital projects.

engagements.subject: Environmental Impact Assessment — Lusaka South Grid Expansion
engagements.attendees: ZESCO Environmental Manager, ZEMA Director General, ZEMA EIA Officer, Lusaka community representatives
engagements.summary: EIA scoping meeting for the Lusaka South grid expansion project covering 150 km of new transmission lines through ecologically sensitive areas.
engagements.outcomes: ZEMA approved EIA Terms of Reference; ZESCO to undertake full EIA study; public consultation process agreed
engagements.followUpActions: ZESCO to submit full EIA report by December 2024; ZEMA to process within 45 working days of receipt

engagements.subject: Environmental Compliance Review — Track Rehabilitation Project
engagements.attendees: ZRL CEO, ZRL Safety and Environment Director, ZEMA Director General, ZEMA Compliance Officer
engagements.summary: Pre-project compliance meeting for the Livingstone-Lusaka track rehabilitation project. Environmental obligations and mitigation measures discussed.
engagements.outcomes: ZEMA confirmed environmental licence conditions; ZRL directed to include wildlife crossing provisions in design
engagements.followUpActions: ZRL to submit environmental management plan by February 2025; ZEMA to conduct baseline environmental audit before works begin

name: Leonard Mwanza
organization: Zambia Competition and Consumer Protection Commission
notes: CCPC regulates competition and consumer protection. Relevant for IDC's investment activity and ZANACO's retail banking product terms. Annual engagement maintained.

engagements.subject: Merger Notification — Zambia Fertiliser and Chemicals Limited Acquisition
engagements.attendees: IDC Legal Counsel, CCPC Director General, CCPC Mergers Team
engagements.summary: IDC submitted formal merger notification to CCPC for ZMW 380 million acquisition of additional equity stake in ZAFCO. CCPC acknowledged receipt.
engagements.outcomes: CCPC accepted filing as complete; 30-day Phase 1 review period commenced 30 January 2025
engagements.followUpActions: IDC to respond to any Phase 1 information requests within 5 working days; CCPC to issue decision by 28 February 2025

name: Meki Mwase
organization: Zambia Union of Financial Institutions and Allied Workers
notes: ZUFIAW represents workers at ZANACO and IDC. Active in collective bargaining and wage negotiations. Early engagement on restructuring plans is critical to avoid industrial action.

engagements.subject: 2025 Collective Bargaining Agreement Negotiations
engagements.attendees: ZANACO HR Director, ZANACO Legal Counsel, ZUFIAW General Secretary, ZUFIAW Negotiating Team
engagements.summary: First round of collective bargaining agreement negotiations for 2025. Union tabled demands including 35% salary increment and improved medical benefits.
engagements.outcomes: Management counter-proposed 18% increment aligned with inflation; gap narrowed but not yet closed; further sessions agreed
engagements.followUpActions: Second round of negotiations scheduled for 25 February 2025; ZANACO to conduct salary benchmarking study

engagements.subject: Consultation on Digital Transformation and Job Security
engagements.attendees: IDC HR Director, ZUFIAW General Secretary, ZUFIAW Research Officer, IDC Labour Relations Manager
engagements.summary: ZUFIAW raised concerns about potential job losses arising from IDC portfolio companies' digital transformation initiatives and automation.
engagements.outcomes: IDC committed to consultation prior to any restructuring affecting employment; skills retraining programme proposed
engagements.followUpActions: IDC to share workforce planning summaries with ZUFIAW by January 2025; joint skills retraining committee to be established

name: Joseph Phiri
organization: Zambia National Union of Transport Workers
notes: ZNUT represents Zambia Railways workers. Active in pay and conditions negotiations. Concerns over job security under the turnaround strategy require proactive engagement.

engagements.subject: 2024 Wage Review and Turnaround Strategy Consultation
engagements.attendees: ZRL HR Director, ZRL CEO, ZNUT General Secretary, ZNUT Executive Committee
engagements.summary: Meeting to consult ZNUT on the 2024 wage review and implications of the turnaround strategy for the ZRL workforce. Union expressed concerns over potential retrenchments.
engagements.outcomes: ZRL committed to no forced retrenchments in 2024; 12% salary increment agreed for 2024; skills development programme announced
engagements.followUpActions: ZRL to share turnaround strategy employment impact assessment with ZNUT by October 2024; joint monitoring committee established

name: Peter Mumba
notes: NUMZ is relevant to ZESCO's operations at mining sector customers and IDC's mining-related portfolio investments. Labour relations in the mining sector affect electricity demand.

engagements.subject: Power Supply to Mining Sector — Load Shedding Impact Consultation
engagements.attendees: ZESCO Commercial Director, ZESCO CEO, NUMZ President, NUMZ Copperbelt Regional Representative, Chamber of Mines representative
engagements.summary: NUMZ raised concerns about impact of load shedding on mining operations and resultant risk to mineworker employment. ZESCO presented mitigation plan.
engagements.outcomes: ZESCO committed to priority supply to operating mines during load shedding; dedicated mine liaison officer appointed
engagements.followUpActions: ZESCO to share weekly power supply schedule for mines with NUMZ; NUMZ to provide feedback on ground impacts monthly

name: Oumar Samba Mamadou
notes: World Bank is a major development finance partner for Zambia's energy and transport infrastructure. Active lender to ZESCO and Zambia Railways. Strong governance expectations.

engagements.subject: Zambia Energy Sector Development Policy Credit — Progress Review
engagements.attendees: ZESCO CEO, CFO, World Bank Country Director, World Bank Energy Specialist, Ministry of Energy PS
engagements.summary: Semi-annual review of the World Bank Energy Sector Development Policy Credit. Progress on energy sector reforms, tariff adjustment, and utility performance reviewed.
engagements.outcomes: World Bank noted satisfactory progress on reform milestones; USD 150 million second tranche disbursement confirmed
engagements.followUpActions: ZESCO to submit Q4 2024 implementation report; World Bank to conduct field visit to Kafue Gorge Lower site in November 2024

engagements.subject: Transport Sector Loan Negotiations — Track Rehabilitation Facility
engagements.attendees: ZRL CEO, CFO, World Bank Country Director, World Bank Transport Specialist, Ministry of Transport PS
engagements.summary: Initial negotiations for a World Bank transport sector loan to co-finance the Livingstone-Lusaka track rehabilitation programme.
engagements.outcomes: World Bank indicated favourable consideration for USD 80 million facility; due diligence process to commence Q1 2025
engagements.followUpActions: ZRL to submit project appraisal documents by March 2025; World Bank to undertake technical due diligence mission

name: Nankali Maksimov
notes: AfDB is a key co-financing partner for IDC, ZESCO, and Zambia Railways. Co-financing facility for SME development active. Energy sector investments under discussion.

engagements.subject: AfDB-IDC Co-Financing Facility Implementation Review
engagements.attendees: IDC CEO, CFO, Investment Director, AfDB Country Manager, AfDB Private Sector Officer
engagements.summary: Annual implementation review of the USD 50 million co-financing facility. Disbursement progress, beneficiary SME performance, and development impact reviewed.
engagements.outcomes: AfDB satisfied with facility implementation; 68% of funds disbursed; positive employment creation outcomes noted
engagements.followUpActions: IDC to submit semi-annual development results report by November 2024; AfDB to consider facility extension by USD 30 million

engagements.subject: AfDB Energy Sector Grant — Rural Electrification Programme
engagements.attendees: ZESCO CEO, Rural Electrification Director, AfDB Country Manager, AfDB Energy Specialist
engagements.summary: ZESCO presented the rural electrification programme for Southern and Eastern provinces requesting AfDB grant co-financing of USD 25 million.
engagements.outcomes: AfDB Country Manager expressed strong interest; referred programme for formal project preparation process
engagements.followUpActions: ZESCO to submit project concept note by April 2025; AfDB to engage regional energy department for technical review

name: Hora Hoban
notes: IMF monitors Zambia's macroeconomic performance and SOE fiscal risks under the Extended Credit Facility programme. SOE financial performance and subsidies are closely scrutinised.

engagements.subject: SOE Portfolio Fiscal Risk Assessment — IMF ECF Review
engagements.attendees: IDC CEO, CFO, IMF Resident Representative, IMF Mission Chief, Ministry of Finance PS
engagements.summary: IMF ECF Article IV consultation included assessment of fiscal risks from Zambia's SOE portfolio. IDC presented consolidated portfolio performance data and fiscal transfer information.
engagements.outcomes: IMF noted improvement in dividend remittances; flagged Zambia Railways fiscal risk; recommended enhanced SOE reporting framework
engagements.followUpActions: IDC to submit enhanced quarterly SOE fiscal risk dashboard to Ministry of Finance; IMF to review framework at next Article IV consultation

engagements.subject: Energy Subsidy Reform Consultation — ZESCO Tariff Adjustment
engagements.attendees: ZESCO CFO, Ministry of Energy PS, IMF Resident Representative, IMF Fiscal Affairs Economist
engagements.summary: IMF consulted with ZESCO and Ministry of Energy on the energy subsidy reform pathway and pace of tariff adjustment as a structural benchmark under the ECF.
engagements.outcomes: IMF affirmed need for cost-reflective tariffs; agreed on a phased adjustment pathway to protect vulnerable consumers
engagements.followUpActions: ZESCO to submit tariff application aligned with ECF structural benchmark timeline; IMF to include tariff adjustment milestone in next review

name: Zambia Daily Mail
notes: State-owned newspaper with wide national readership. Important channel for public communications on SOE performance, tariff changes, and government policy. Regular press releases issued.

engagements.subject: Media Briefing — Load Shedding Schedule and Mitigation Measures
engagements.attendees: ZESCO Corporate Affairs Director, ZESCO CEO, Zambia Daily Mail Business Editor
engagements.summary: ZESCO held media briefing to explain the load shedding situation, El Niño impact on Kariba, and mitigation measures being implemented. Questions from journalists addressed.
engagements.outcomes: Zambia Daily Mail published factual and balanced front-page story; public understanding improved; ZESCO committed to weekly updates
engagements.followUpActions: ZESCO to issue weekly load shedding schedule updates to all media; monthly briefings with business editor scheduled

name: ZNBC
notes: National state broadcaster with television, radio, and digital platforms. Important partner for public information campaigns and corporate communications.

engagements.subject: Financial Literacy Campaign Partnership 2025
engagements.attendees: ZANACO Head of Marketing, ZNBC Director of Programmes, ZNBC Commercial Manager
engagements.summary: Discussion on a joint financial literacy campaign to promote saving culture and digital banking through ZNBC's Cinyanja and Nyanja language programmes.
engagements.outcomes: Partnership agreement in principle reached; ZANACO to sponsor 12-week financial literacy series on ZNBC Radio 2
engagements.followUpActions: ZANACO to confirm sponsorship budget of ZMW 4.5 million; ZNBC to submit content proposal by February 2025

name: Chikwanda Chikwanda
notes: Community leader representing residential areas in Lusaka affected by electricity outages, ZANACO branch services, and railway noise. Community consultations required for infrastructure projects.

engagements.subject: Community Consultation — Lusaka North Grid Expansion Project
engagements.attendees: ZESCO Community Relations Officer, ZESCO Environmental Manager, Chikwanda Chikwanda, Community representatives from 5 wards
engagements.summary: Public consultation on the Lusaka North distribution network reinforcement project. Community concerns raised about construction noise, traffic, and temporary supply interruptions.
engagements.outcomes: Community agreed to project proceeding subject to ZESCO commitments on construction hours and compensation for outages
engagements.followUpActions: ZESCO to issue community liaison committee charter; monthly community update meetings to be held during construction

name: Mary Phiri
notes: Community representative for Copperbelt residential areas. Concerned about electricity supply quality, tariff affordability, and ZRL rail crossings safety.

engagements.subject: Copperbelt Community Power Supply Quality Complaints
engagements.attendees: ZESCO Copperbelt Regional Manager, ZESCO Customer Relations Officer, Mary Phiri, CCDA Committee members
engagements.summary: Community meeting to address complaints about frequent outages and voltage fluctuations in Ndola and Kitwe residential areas. ZESCO presented technical causes and remedial plan.
engagements.outcomes: ZESCO committed to completing substation upgrade in Ndola by October 2024; dedicated community helpline number provided
engagements.followUpActions: ZESCO to provide monthly outage statistics to CCDA; compensation mechanism for extended outages to be communicated

name: Zambia Chamber of Commerce and Industry
organization: Zambia Chamber of Commerce and Industry
notes: ZACCI represents the private sector on issues including energy costs, banking services, and transport reliability. Channels business community concerns to SOEs and government.

engagements.stakeholderName: Zambia Chamber of Commerce and Industry
engagements.subject: Business Impact of Load Shedding — Private Sector Roundtable
engagements.attendees: ZESCO CEO, ZACCO CEO, Business executives from 35 member companies, ERB Technical Director
engagements.summary: Roundtable to assess the economic impact of load shedding on Zambian businesses and explore collaborative solutions including solar installations and backup power.
engagements.outcomes: Business sector estimated monthly losses of ZMW 800 million from load shedding; ZESCO committed to priority supply protocols for certain business categories
engagements.followUpActions: ZESCO and ZACCI to establish joint technical working group on business energy solutions; ZESCO to develop SME solar subsidy proposal

engagements.stakeholderName: Zambia Chamber of Commerce and Industry
engagements.subject: SME Financing Access — ZANACO Engagement
engagements.attendees: ZANACO MD/CEO, ZANACO MSME Director, ZACCI CEO, ZACCI SME Committee Chairperson
engagements.summary: Meeting to review ZANACO's MSME lending programme and barriers to SME access to finance. ZACCI presented case studies of members facing collateral and documentation challenges.
engagements.outcomes: ZANACO committed to streamlining MSME application process; alternative collateral framework to be developed; target turnaround of 5 business days for SME loans
engagements.followUpActions: ZANACO to share revised MSME product terms with ZACCI by March 2025; joint SME financing awareness campaign planned

name: Chilufya Mutale
notes: Chamber of Mines represents large-scale mining companies which are ZESCO's largest customers. Power supply reliability and tariffs are critical concerns. Active advocacy on energy policy.

engagements.subject: Mining Sector Power Supply Agreement Review 2025
engagements.attendees: ZESCO CEO, Commercial Director, Chamber of Mines Executive Director, Mines Energy Managers from 6 companies
engagements.summary: Annual review of power supply agreements with the mining sector. Chamber raised concerns about tariff increases and supply reliability during load shedding.
engagements.outcomes: Agreement on dedicated power supply protocols for mines; phased tariff adjustment pathway agreed; ZESCO to upgrade dedicated mining supply substations
engagements.followUpActions: ZESCO to present substation upgrade plan by December 2024; new power supply agreements to be signed by January 2025

engagements.subject: Mining Freight Transport Reliability Review
engagements.attendees: ZRL CEO, Commercial Director, Chamber of Mines Executive Director, Mine Logistics Managers
engagements.summary: Meeting to review ZRL's freight reliability for mining concentrate haulage and discuss the impact of track conditions on transit times.
engagements.outcomes: ZRL and Chamber of Mines agreed to jointly track freight performance KPIs; ZRL committed to reducing average transit time by 20% through track rehabilitation
engagements.followUpActions: ZRL to share quarterly freight performance dashboards with Chamber; penalties and incentive framework for freight contracts to be reviewed

name: NAPSA
notes: NAPSA is a significant institutional investor and shareholder in ZANACO. Has fiduciary responsibilities to pensioners and actively monitors investment returns, governance, and ESG performance.

engagements.subject: ZANACO Investor Briefing — 2024 Annual Performance
engagements.attendees: ZANACO MD/CEO, CFO, Company Secretary, NAPSA Director General, NAPSA Investment Director
engagements.summary: Annual investor briefing presenting ZANACO's 2024 financial results, dividend declaration, and 2025 strategy. NAPSA assessed returns on its shareholding.
engagements.outcomes: NAPSA satisfied with 2024 results and dividend; expressed support for digital transformation strategy; requested ESG report by Q2 2025
engagements.followUpActions: ZANACO to provide NAPSA with quarterly investor updates; ESG and sustainability report to be issued by June 2025

engagements.subject: IDC Co-Investment Opportunities Presentation
engagements.attendees: IDC CEO, Investment Director, NAPSA Director General, NAPSA Investments Committee
engagements.summary: IDC presented co-investment pipeline in agricultural processing, green energy, and manufacturing sectors to NAPSA as a potential co-investor.
engagements.outcomes: NAPSA expressed interest in three investment proposals; due diligence visit to two sites agreed
engagements.followUpActions: IDC to provide detailed investment memoranda by September 2024; NAPSA due diligence team to visit sites in October 2024

name: GRZ Treasury
organization: Ministry of Finance and National Planning — Treasury
notes: GRZ Treasury is the ultimate shareholder of all four SOEs. Key decisions on dividends, capital injections, and government guarantees are made through Treasury. Quarterly reporting mandatory.

engagements.subject: Q3 2024 SOE Portfolio Performance — Treasury Review
engagements.attendees: IDC CEO, CFO, Treasury Secretary, Treasury SOE Director, Ministry of Finance Budget Director
engagements.summary: Quarterly portfolio performance review with GRZ Treasury. Key metrics including revenue performance, dividend pipeline, and capital adequacy presented for all four SOEs.
engagements.outcomes: Treasury noted strong ZANACO performance; raised concerns over Zambia Railways financial position; requested enhanced ZRL reporting
engagements.followUpActions: IDC to provide enhanced ZRL monthly financial reports to Treasury from November 2024; IDC CFO to brief Treasury on 2025 dividend schedule

engagements.subject: ZESCO Subsidy and Capital Support Framework 2025
engagements.attendees: ZESCO CEO, CFO, Treasury Secretary, Ministry of Energy PS, Treasury Budget Officer
engagements.summary: Discussions on the government subsidy arrangement for ZESCO in 2025 and capital support for the Kafue Gorge Lower commissioning costs.
engagements.outcomes: Treasury confirmed ZMW 1.2 billion in government subsidy support for 2025; capital grant of ZMW 350 million for KGL commissioning approved
engagements.followUpActions: ZESCO to sign amended performance agreement with Treasury by February 2025; quarterly subsidy disbursement schedule agreed

name: Development Bank of Zambia
notes: DBZ is a key development finance institution providing long-term lending to Zambia Railways and co-financing with IDC for SME and infrastructure projects.

engagements.subject: DBZ Long-Term Facility for Rolling Stock Procurement
engagements.attendees: ZRL CEO, CFO, DBZ CEO, DBZ Credit Director, Ministry of Transport PS
engagements.summary: Discussions on a DBZ long-term credit facility of ZMW 480 million to co-finance the procurement of 12 new diesel locomotives and 80 freight wagons.
engagements.outcomes: DBZ confirmed in-principle approval for facility subject to due diligence; government guarantee letter required as condition
engagements.followUpActions: ZRL to submit formal loan application by January 2025; Ministry of Transport to facilitate government guarantee process

engagements.subject: IDC-DBZ Co-Financing Framework for Agricultural Investments
engagements.attendees: IDC CEO, Investment Director, DBZ CEO, DBZ Agribusiness Director
engagements.summary: Joint meeting to develop a co-financing framework for agricultural sector investments combining IDC equity and DBZ debt in targeted agri-processing projects.
engagements.outcomes: Framework structure agreed; three pilot investments identified for co-financing; combined investment target of ZMW 650 million set
engagements.followUpActions: IDC and DBZ to co-develop term sheet for first pilot investment by March 2025; co-financing agreement to be signed by May 2025

name: ZANACO Shareholders Collective
notes: ZANACO is listed on the Lusaka Securities Exchange. Shareholders include NAPSA, GRZ, and institutional and retail investors. Regular investor relations engagement required.

engagements.subject: ZANACO Investor Day 2024
engagements.attendees: ZANACO Board Chair, MD/CEO, CFO, Chief Risk Officer, LuSE representatives, institutional and retail investors
engagements.summary: Annual Investor Day presenting H1 2024 results, strategy update, and dividend outlook. 85 investors attended in person and via webcast.
engagements.outcomes: Strong investor confidence in ZANACO's digital strategy; share price increased 8% in the week following the event
engagements.followUpActions: ZANACO IR team to respond to individual investor queries within 5 business days; next investor communication at Q3 2024 results

name: ZCCM Investments Holdings Plc
notes: ZCCM-IH is a significant institutional investor in Zambia's energy and industrial sectors with overlapping portfolio interests with IDC. Collaboration on investment opportunities explored.

engagements.subject: IDC-ZCCM-IH Investment Portfolio Coordination Meeting
engagements.attendees: IDC CEO, Investment Director, ZCCM-IH Group MD, ZCCM-IH Investment Director
engagements.summary: Biannual coordination meeting to share investment pipeline updates and identify areas of collaboration and potential co-investment between IDC and ZCCM-IH.
engagements.outcomes: Three areas of potential co-investment identified in renewable energy, mining services, and agro-processing; joint due diligence proposed
engagements.followUpActions: Both organisations to share investment memoranda on identified opportunities by July 2024; joint working group to be established

name: National Assembly of Zambia
organization: National Assembly of Zambia — Parliamentary Committee on Parastatal Bodies
notes: Parliamentary oversight committee on parastatal bodies. Conducts annual reviews of SOE performance, financial management, and governance. Summons CEOs and board chairs to appear before committee.

engagements.subject: Parliamentary Committee Appearance — IDC 2023 Annual Performance
engagements.attendees: IDC CEO, CFO, Board Chair, Parliamentary Committee Chairperson, 12 Committee Members
engagements.summary: IDC appeared before the Parliamentary Committee on Parastatal Bodies to present 2023 performance, dividend remittances, and portfolio management. Committee raised questions on transparency.
engagements.outcomes: Committee commended IDC's dividend performance but raised concerns about Zambia Railways financial position and IDC's oversight role
engagements.followUpActions: IDC to submit written response to Committee's 15 questions within 14 days; ZRL CEO to appear separately before Committee

engagements.subject: Parliamentary Committee Appearance — ZRL Turnaround Strategy
engagements.attendees: ZRL CEO, CFO, Board Chair, Parliamentary Committee Chairperson, 10 Committee Members
engagements.summary: ZRL appeared before Parliament to account for poor financial performance and present the turnaround strategy. Committee expressed frustration at recurring losses.
engagements.outcomes: Committee directed ZRL to achieve operational breakeven by end of 2025; ZRL to report quarterly to Committee on progress
engagements.followUpActions: ZRL to submit quarterly turnaround progress reports to Committee; next appearance scheduled for Q1 2025

name: Office of the Auditor General
organization: Office of the Auditor General of Zambia
notes: Conducts independent audits of all government-owned entities. Audit findings are reported to Parliament. Non-compliance with audit recommendations carries reputational and legal risk.

engagements.subject: ZESCO 2023 Financial Audit Exit Meeting
engagements.attendees: ZESCO CFO, Company Secretary, Auditor General representative, Audit team lead
engagements.summary: Exit meeting for the 2023 ZESCO financial audit. Auditors presented preliminary findings including three material weaknesses in internal controls over procurement.
engagements.outcomes: ZESCO acknowledged findings; management letter responses agreed; internal audit committee to implement recommendations within 90 days
engagements.followUpActions: ZESCO to submit management letter responses by 30 August 2024; follow-up review by OAG scheduled for November 2024

engagements.subject: ZRL 2022 Audit Report — Outstanding Recommendations Follow-Up
engagements.attendees: ZRL CFO, ZRL Company Secretary, OAG Audit Manager
engagements.summary: OAG issued formal follow-up letter on implementation status of 22 recommendations from the 2022 ZRL audit report. ZRL had implemented only 9 of 22 recommendations.
engagements.outcomes: ZRL committed to implementing remaining 13 recommendations by December 2024; implementation matrix submitted
engagements.followUpActions: ZRL to provide monthly implementation status updates to OAG; OAG to conduct verification visit in January 2025

name: Zambia Revenue Authority
notes: ZRA administers tax compliance for all SOEs including VAT, PAYE, corporate income tax, and withholding taxes. Tax disputes and assessments require careful management.

engagements.subject: ZANACO Corporate Tax Assessment 2021–2022 Review
engagements.attendees: ZANACO CFO, Tax Manager, External Tax Counsel, ZRA Commissioner — Large Taxpayers, ZRA Assessment Officer
engagements.summary: Meeting to review ZRA's additional corporate tax assessment of ZMW 180 million for the 2021–2022 tax years. ZANACO disputed the basis of the assessment.
engagements.outcomes: ZRA agreed to review ZANACO's objection; alternative dispute resolution process agreed; ZRA committed to response within 60 days
engagements.followUpActions: ZANACO to submit formal written objection with supporting documentation by 18 June 2024; ZRA to convene technical review panel

engagements.subject: ZESCO VAT Refund Application — ZMW 320 Million
engagements.attendees: ZESCO CFO, Tax Controller, ZRA Commissioner — Large Taxpayers
engagements.summary: ZESCO formally applied for VAT refund of ZMW 320 million accumulated over 18 months. ZRA acknowledged receipt and commenced review process.
engagements.outcomes: ZRA confirmed receipt; verification audit to be conducted within 45 working days; interim payment of ZMW 80 million agreed while review ongoing
engagements.followUpActions: ZESCO to provide supporting documentation to ZRA by 26 September 2024; ZRA to complete review by end of November 2024

name: Local Suppliers and SMEs
organization: Zambia Association of Manufacturers / Local Supplier Network
notes: Local suppliers and SMEs are critical partners for procurement and local content compliance. SOEs are expected to meet local procurement targets under national policy. Regular supplier engagement supports B-BBEE-equivalent goals.

engagements.subject: ZESCO Supplier Development Forum 2024
engagements.attendees: ZESCO CEO, Procurement Director, 120 local suppliers and SME representatives, ZAM CEO, ZACCI representative
engagements.summary: Annual supplier development forum covering ZESCO's procurement pipeline, local content requirements, and capacity building for SME suppliers. Procurement opportunities worth ZMW 850 million presented.
engagements.outcomes: 28 new suppliers registered in ZESCO's supplier database; commitment to achieve 40% local procurement by value in 2025; mentorship programme for SMEs launched
engagements.followUpActions: ZESCO Procurement to issue supplier development programme details by November 2024; quarterly supplier clinics to be held in 2025

name: First Quantum Minerals Ltd
position: Joint Venture Partner — Kansanshi Copper Mine
notes: First Quantum Minerals holds ~80% of Kansanshi Mining PLC, with ZCCM-IH holding ~20%. Kansanshi is one of Africa's largest copper mines. FQM is ZCCM-IH's most significant portfolio partner, contributing the majority of dividend income. Annual engagement via the Kansanshi Mining PLC board and shareholder meetings.

engagements.subject: Kansanshi Mining PLC Annual Shareholders Meeting 2024
engagements.attendees: ZCCM-IH CEO, ZCCM-IH Investment Director, FQM CEO, FQM CFO, Kansanshi General Manager
engagements.summary: Review of Kansanshi Mine 2023 production results (copper 236,000t, gold 162,000oz), FY2024 production guidance, capital expenditure programme, and dividend declaration of USD 85,000,000 to shareholders.
engagements.outcomes: ZCCM-IH 20% dividend share confirmed at USD 17,000,000 (ZMW 480,000,000). FY2024 guidance of 240,000t copper agreed. Environmental remediation programme reviewed.
engagements.followUpActions: ZCCM-IH to receive quarterly production reports; Joint environmental compliance committee to meet quarterly

name: Barrick Gold Corporation
position: Joint Venture Partner — Lumwana Copper Mine
notes: Barrick Gold owns 100% of Lumwana Mine with ZCCM-IH holding a ~10% free-carry interest under the Lumwana Development Agreement. Lumwana is a large-scale open-pit copper mine in North-Western Province. ZCCM-IH engages via the Lumwana Mine Operating Committee and bilateral government-Barrick engagement forums.

engagements.subject: Lumwana Mine Super Pit Expansion — Stakeholder Briefing 2024
engagements.attendees: ZCCM-IH CEO, ZCCM-IH Investment Director, Barrick Africa President, Lumwana MD, Ministry of Mines representative
engagements.summary: Barrick presented the USD 2 billion Lumwana Super Pit expansion feasibility study extending mine life by 37 years. ZCCM-IH briefed on implications for free-carry dividend stream and environmental obligations.
engagements.outcomes: ZCCM-IH noted no additional capital contribution required under free-carry arrangement. ESG impact assessment shared. Next briefing scheduled post-FID.
engagements.followUpActions: ZCCM-IH to review expansion EIA; monitor Final Investment Decision expected Q4 2024

name: Lusaka Securities Exchange (LuSE)
notes: ZCCM-IH is dual-listed on the Lusaka Securities Exchange (primary listing) and London Stock Exchange AIM market. LuSE sets listing requirements, continuous disclosure obligations, and corporate governance standards for listed companies. Regular engagement with LuSE compliance team for regulatory filings, trading updates, and rule interpretations.

engagements.subject: LuSE Annual Issuer Compliance Review 2024
engagements.attendees: ZCCM-IH Company Secretary, ZCCM-IH CFO, LuSE Chief Regulatory Officer, LuSE Listings Manager
engagements.summary: Annual compliance review covering ZCCM-IH's adherence to LuSE Listing Requirements. All continuous disclosure obligations met. One observation on timeliness of trading update disclosure reviewed.
engagements.outcomes: ZCCM-IH confirmed full compliance with LuSE listing requirements. Process enhancement agreed for trading updates.
engagements.followUpActions: ZCCM-IH to implement revised trading update disclosure procedure by Q2 2024

name: Zambia Environmental Management Agency (ZEMA)
notes: ZEMA regulates environmental management across ZCCM-IH's portfolio mining operations, overseeing environmental licence conditions, acid mine drainage, tailings facilities, and mine rehabilitation obligations. ZCCM-IH engages ZEMA regularly for compliance reporting, rehabilitation fund adequacy reviews, and environmental impact assessments for new investments.

engagements.subject: ZEMA Portfolio Mine Environmental Compliance Inspection 2024
engagements.attendees: ZCCM-IH Environmental Manager, ZEMA Regional Inspector, Portfolio Mine Environmental Officers (Kansanshi, Lumwana, Chibuluma)
engagements.summary: ZEMA conducted joint compliance inspection of environmental licence conditions at key portfolio mines. Acid mine drainage at the former Luanshya site reviewed. Tailings facility certifications current. Mine rehabilitation fund balance confirmed at ZMW 3.8 billion.
engagements.outcomes: No critical non-compliances identified. Minor observation on monitoring frequency at one tailings facility. Rehabilitation fund deemed adequate for current closure cost estimates.
engagements.followUpActions: ZCCM-IH to increase monitoring frequency at Chibuluma tailings facility; Submit updated AMD remediation schedule by September 2024

name: Copperbelt Mining Communities
notes: Communities in the Copperbelt Province and North-Western Province surrounding ZCCM-IH portfolio mines are key social licence stakeholders. Key concerns include employment localisation, environmental remediation, community development fund disbursements, and mine closure contingency planning. Regular community liaison through Community Liaison Councils at each portfolio mine site.

engagements.subject: ZCCM-IH Annual Community Investment Report Forum 2024
engagements.attendees: ZCCM-IH CEO, ZCCM-IH Sustainability Manager, Community Liaison Council Chairs (8 councils), Copperbelt Provincial Administration, District Councils
engagements.summary: ZCCM-IH presented the 2023 Community Investment Report showing ZMW 35,000,000 disbursed across education, health, and infrastructure projects in host communities. Communities raised concerns about employment localisation and AMD water contamination in the Kafue tributary.
engagements.outcomes: ZCCM-IH committed to review localisation targets with portfolio mines; AMD contamination study commissioned; Community Investment Programme 2025 budget of ZMW 38,000,000 announced.
engagements.followUpActions: AMD Kafue tributary water quality monitoring report to communities by November 2024; Employment localisation review with FQM and Barrick by Q1 2025

name: Hon. Paul Kabuswe
organization: Ministry of Mines and Minerals Development
position: Minister of Mines and Minerals Development
notes: Primary ministerial oversight for Zambia Gold Company Limited. Key decision-maker on gold dealer licensing, artisanal mining policy, mercury-free processing directives, and ASM formalisation programme targets. Quarterly briefings maintained.

engagements.subject: Zambia Gold Company FY2023 Performance Review and ASM Formalisation Update
engagements.attendees: Zambia Gold CEO, Zambia Gold CFO, Ministry PS, Ministry Director of Mines
engagements.summary: Zambia Gold presented FY2023 performance showing revenue of ZMW 2,450,000,000 and net profit of ZMW 270,000,000. ASM formalisation update showed 720 miners registered. Mercury-free processing kit distribution programme presented.
engagements.outcomes: Minister expressed satisfaction with revenue growth. Directed acceleration of ASM formalisation programme to 5,000 miners by December 2026. Mercury-free processing directive formally issued.
engagements.followUpActions: Zambia Gold to submit revised ASM formalisation plan with monthly targets; Ministry to provide additional budget support for Phase 2 formalisation programme.

engagements.subject: Gold Refinery Phase 2 Expansion — Ministerial Briefing
engagements.attendees: Zambia Gold CEO, Ministry PS, Ministry Director of Mines, Ministry Director of Investment Promotion
engagements.summary: Zambia Gold presented the gold refinery Phase 2 feasibility study scope and financing plan. Proposed expansion will increase refining capacity to 5 tonnes per month and position Zambia as a regional gold refining hub.
engagements.outcomes: Minister endorsed the refinery expansion strategic direction. Ministry to support financing application to Trade Development Bank. Government guarantee for TDB facility to be considered by Ministry of Finance.
engagements.followUpActions: Zambia Gold to submit formal financing application to TDB by March 2025; Ministry to write support letter for TDB application by February 2025.

name: Artisanal Miners Association of Zambia
notes: AMAZ represents artisanal and small-scale gold miners across Zambia and is a key partner in the gold formalisation programme. Key concerns include gold buying prices, payment speed, licensing barriers, and access to equipment. Regular engagement ensures gold channels through Zambia Gold Company rather than informal markets.

engagements.subject: Gold Buying Price Review and Payment Terms Consultation
engagements.attendees: Zambia Gold CEO, Zambia Gold COO, AMAZ President, AMAZ Executive Committee (5 members), Regional Coordinators (12 provinces)
engagements.summary: Quarterly consultation on gold buying prices. AMAZ raised concerns that Zambia Gold prices were 3-5% below market in July and August 2024 due to administrative delays in price updates. Miners also requested faster payment processing at buying centres.
engagements.outcomes: Zambia Gold committed to update buying prices daily in line with LBMA daily fix with same-day publication to all centres. Payment processing time to be reduced from 48 hours to 24 hours. Mobile payment pilot to be launched at 3 buying centres in Q4 2024.
engagements.followUpActions: Daily price publication system to be operational by 1 October 2024; Mobile payment pilot launched at Mufumbwe, Kabompo, and Mpika buying centres.
